description.en:
The course assumes that the participants already have a knowledge of basic statistics and the use of R (on the level that was covered in the Quantitative Methods I course). The content of the course is structured around seminars, which will introduce the particular topics that are related to the learning objectives and where we will go over the general logic of the methods as well as their application in R. 

The first sessions will fill in the gaps about how to use R for data processing and management. We will look at some data types and structures of R code that go beyond the very basics of what was necessary for a novice R user. We will focus more on textual data and how to prepare texts for statistical analysis and will also have a look at how to acquire text from the web - how to program R to automatically download the content of web pages.   

From there we will move on to the already familiar regression model and will have a look at how to expand this into some contexts that go beyond its standard conditions of application. We will learn how to analyse associations among variables with factor analysis and how to use principal component analysis for data reduction. The third part of the class will end with a brief introduction of how to apply basic machine learning models in R.

The last part of the class will focus on models of textual analysis. We will look at how to detect emotions in text (sentiment analysis), how to locate texts on certain dimensions like ideological dimensions and how to use unsupervised machine learning to detect topics from texts. 

Each part of the class will be accompanied with homeworks and the class will end with all participants preparing and presenting a plan of analysis that uses some of the methods that were introduced in this class.
description.et:
Kursus eeldab, et osalejatel on juba olemas põhiteadmised sellest, kuidas kasutada R-i ja kuidas teha põhilisi statistilisi analüüse (tasemel, mida kaeti aines Kvantitatiivsed meetodid I). Kursuse sisu on struktureeritud ümber seminaride, mida tutvustavad õpieesmärkidega seotud teemasid ning kus me harjutame koos läbi nende meetodite üldise loogika ning nende rakendamise R-s. 

Esimesed sessioonid on keskendunud sellele, kuidas kasutada R-i andmete töötlemiseks ja haldamiseks. Me heidame pilgu teatud andmetüüpidele ja R-i koodile, mida läheb mõnevõrra kaugemale päris esmastest teadmistest sellest, mis oli R-ga alustava kasutaja jaoks vajalik. Me keskendume muuhulhgas ka tekstilistele andmetele ning sellele, kuidas tekste statistiliseks analüüsiks ette valmistada. Samuti vaatame, kuidas automaatselt alla laadida veebilehekülgede tekstilist või numbrilist sisu. 

Sealt liigume edasi juba tuttava regressioonimudeli juurde ning vaatame, kuidas seda laiendada teatud kontekstidesse, kus lihtsat OLS-i rakendada ei saa. Uurime, kuidas saab analüüside seoseid muutujate vahel kasutades selleks faktoranalüüsi ja peakomponentide analüüsi. Kolmas osa kursusest lõpeb lühikese sissejuhatusega sellest, kuidas rakendada lihtsat masinõppemudelit R-s. 

Viimane osa kursusest keskendub tekstianalüüsi mudelitele. Me vaatame seda, kuidas tuvastada tekstidest emotsioone, kuidas paigutada tekste teatud dimensioonidele (skaleerimine) nagu näiteks ideoloogilised dimensioonid ning kuidas kasutada masinõppemeetodeid selleks, et tuvastada tekstidest nendes esinevaid teemasid. 

Kursuse iga osa juurde kuuluvad vastavad kodutööd ning kursus lõpeb sellega, et kõik osalejad valmistavad ette analüüsiplaani, mis kasutab mõningaid kursuse jooksul tutvustatud meetodeid.

objectives.en: The aim of this class is to give participants practical skills in using R for data analysis and management. The course will be a continuation of the Quantitative Methods I (SHRG.03.024) course and has two primary objectives:
objectives.et: Kursuse eesmärgiks on anda osalejatele praktilised ja laiapõjalisemad oskused R-i kasutamisel andmete haldamiseks ja analüüsiksl. Tegemist on jätkukursusega ainele Kvantitatiivsed meetodid I (SHRG.03.024) ning kususel on kaks peamist eesmärki:

objectives.en: - to extend the participants knowledge of R for general data processing and management and
objectives.et: - laiendada osalejate teadmisi R-st andmete töötlemisel ja haldamisel ning

objectives.en: - to expand on their knowledge of more advanced statistical models, especially for the analysis of textual data.
objectives.et: - laiendada osalejate teadmisi keerukamatest statistilise analüüsi meetoditest, eriti tekstianalüüsi meetodietst.

learning_outcomes.en: Upon completion of the course, the students will have an understanding of how to use R for:
learning_outcomes.et: Kursuse lõppedes on osalejad omandanud teadmised sellest, kuidas kasutada R-i:

notes.et: A laptop is required to participate in the seminars (with R and RStudio installed). Any laptop that runs Mac OS, Windows 10 or Linux (e.g. Ubuntu) is suitable. Laptops running ChromeOS are not suitable.

independent_work.et: The homework of the class will be comprised of individual homework assignments (the course will feature 5 such assignments) and a research plan together with preliminary analyses that will need to be submitted and presented by the end of the class. The homework assignments are short tasks, that require the participants to independently complete tasks related to data analysis and management that were covered in the seminars. By the end of the class the participants need to submit a research plan, that will broadly define a substantive research problem (based on existing literature on the topic), choose a data set for the analysis of that problem and conduct preliminary analyses using some of the techniques and methods that were covered in class. More detailed information about the assignments will be provided through Moodle.

description.et: Research plan and preliminary analyses to be submitted at the end of the class (50% of the final grade). The reseach plan will need to include a theoreticaly motivated research question and analyses based on a selecated data set that provide preliminary answers to these questions. The last session of the class will be devoted to presentations of the plans.

Independent homework assignments (5 x 10% = 50% of the final grade).

All of the individual homework assignments are divided into specific tasks particular to each assignment. These tasks involve the implementation of a particular technique or model in R. The tasks are assigned points and these points are counted to the extent that these tasks are properly completed according to the instructions of each assignment.

grade_preconditions.et:
All homeworks are to be submitted by their deadlines. Late submissions are allowed only in extraordinary circumstances and if the instructor has been informed beforehand. 

Re-submissions in order to improve the grade are not possible.

grade_evaluation.et:
The 5 individual homework assignments will make up 50% of the final grade (10% each) and the research plan (with the preliminary analyses and presentation) will make up 50% of the grade. 

The points from the individual assignments and the research plan will be added together (for a total of 100% of the grade). The final grade (letter) for the class will be assigned as follows from the sum total of the scores of each assignment and the research plan:

F - less than 50%
E - more than 50% but less than 60%
D - more than 60% but less than 70% 
C - more than 70% but less than 80%
B - more than 80% but less than 90%
A - more than 90%

debt_elimination.et: If the final grade for the class is under 50%, then the only possibility to improve the grade is to take the class again.

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)

resources.mandatory_materials: The course will be based on seminar materials that have been especially prepared for this class. Everything will be made available through Moodle.
resources.recommended_materials: Additional readings will be provided for each topic, where necessary. Everything will be made available through Moodle.
